title._content: Students protest against NUI degrees for NIHE students 1976

description._content:
Ref: UL40/Box1/Folder22

Students of NIHE Limerick criticise the conditions under which they would be awarded degrees by the National University of Ireland (NUI). Left to right: Niall Duggan, Derek Dunne, Gerard Slattery, Mike McDonnell.

Derek Dunne attended the NIHE and he subsequently became a journalist with much of his work appearing in Magill magazine in the 1980’s. He wrote ‘Round up the usual suspects: Nicky Kelly & the Cosgrave Coalition’ with Gene Kerrigan [Magill 1984] and ‘Out of the Maze: the true story of the biggest jail escape since the war’ [Gill & MacMillan 1988], ‘The Birmingham six’ [Birmingham Six Committee 1988]. He died 26th October 1991.
